meanings.definition: Substances that retain moisture or prevent loss of moisture.
meanings.sent1: The skincare product contains humectants to keep the skin hydrated.
meanings.sent2: Humectants are commonly used in lotions to help the skin stay moisturized.
meanings.sent3: The humectants in the lotion were like tiny sponges soaking up all the water.
meanings.sent4: Her love for plants was like the humectants in the soil, always keeping them nourished.
meanings.sent5: The desert plant's ability to store water was compared to the role of humectants in skincare products.

meanings.definition: Agents that attract and hold water molecules.
meanings.sent1: The humectants in the shampoo help to lock in moisture and prevent dryness.
meanings.sent2: When shopping for hair products, look for those with humectants to keep your hair hydrated.
meanings.sent3: The humectants in the conditioner were like magnets for water, keeping the hair soft and smooth.
meanings.sent4: In the kitchen, salt can act as a humectant for preserving food by drawing out moisture.
meanings.sent5: The humectants in the air were like invisible hands holding onto every water molecule, creating a humid environment.
